de.eckhartarnold.client

Class ImagePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • Composite
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.ImagePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResizeListener, SourcesAttachmentEvents

    public class ImagePanel
extends Composite
implements SourcesAttachmentEvents, ResizeListener
    Displays a photo on an absolute panel.

    The image is scaled so as to use as much space of the panel as possible without distorting the aspect ratio of the image. When the image is exchanged the old image is faded out while the new image is faded in smoothly.

    Author:
    eckhart

    • Field Detail

      • active

        protected Image active
        The currently active image. When a new photo is loaded the image that was displayed previously is declared passive and a new active image is created in the front that takes the new photo and is faded in.

      • passive

        protected Image passive
        The image that was displayed out and is either already invisible, i.e. faded out, or just about to be faded out.

      • panel

        protected AbsolutePanel panel
        The main widget of the image panel. The images are placed on panel and their size adjusted.

      • envelope

        protected SimplePanel envelope
        An envelope panel that wraps the AbsolutePanel. This is necessary for working around some browser differences in connection with resizing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImagePanel

        public ImagePanel(ImageCollectionInfo collection)
        Constructor of class ImagePanel. Before the flip panel becomes visible, it must be added somewhere to the DOM tree (e.g. to the root panel) and the onResized method must be called.

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration()
        Returns the duration for which an image will be displayed without fading.
        Returns:
        The duration for image display in milliseconds.

      • getFading

        public int getFading()
        Returns the fading duration. A negative value indicates that fading is sequentially, only after the last image has faded out completely, the new image fades in. In this case the actual fading time is twice the absolute value of fading
        Returns:
        The duration of fading in milliseconds.

      • getImageURL

        public java.lang.String getImageURL()
        Returns the URL of the largest size version(!) of the currently displayed image.
        Returns:
        the image's URL

      • onResized

        public void onResized()
        Resizes the displayed image(s), if the containing FlipImagePanel has been resized. The resize method is called automatically when any of the methods setSize, setPixelSize, setWidth, setHeight is called.
        Specified by:
        onResized in interface ResizeListener

      • prepareResized

        public void prepareResized()
        Removes the AbsolutePanel so that the image panels size can be determined correctly by the browser before calling onResized. The AbsolutePanel is restored by method onResized. This method therefore should always be used in conjunction with the method onResized.
        Specified by:
        prepareResized in interface ResizeListener

      • removeAttachmentListener

        public void removeAttachmentListener(AttachmentListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: SourcesAttachmentEvents
        Removes an AttachmentListener from the widget.
        Specified by:
        removeAttachmentListener in interface SourcesAttachmentEvents
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be removed

      • setDuration

        public void setDuration(int msecs)
        Sets the duration for which an image will be displayed without fading.
        Parameters:
        msecs - The duration for image display in milliseconds.

      • setFading

        public void setFading(int msecs)
        Sets the duration for fading in a new image. A negative value of the parameter msecs indicates that fading in and fading out does not occur synchronously but in sequence. Please observe that in this case the total fading phase takes twice as long!
        Parameters:
        msecs - The duration of fading in or out in milliseconds.

      • showImage

        public void showImage(java.lang.String url,
             ImagePanel.DisplayListener notifier)
        Shows the image that the given URl points to.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the image to show
        notifier - a callback that is issued when the image is loaded and has faded in

      • showImage

        public void showImage(java.lang.String[] urls,
             int[][] sizes,
             ImagePanel.DisplayListener notifier)
        Shows a picture for which representations with different image sizes exist. The representation, the size of which best fits the FlipImagePanel widget's size is picked. If the widget is resized so that another representation would be more appropriate, the image is automatically exchanged.
        Parameters:
        urls - the URL of different sized versions of the same image, each of them corresponding to one of the sizes
        sizes - the sizes of the different versions of the images.
        notifier - a callback that is issued when the image is loaded and has faded in

      • getSizeStep

        int getSizeStep()
        Returns the currently selected size step, if image URLs for several size steps have been specified by the last call of method showImage(). Returns -1 otherwise. This method has been made package private, because the information about the selected size step is needed for prefetching. See Slideshow.show.
        Returns:
        the currently selected size step or -1, if not several size steps have been specified.

      • exchangeImage

        protected void exchangeImage(java.lang.String url,
                 ImagePanel.DisplayListener notifier)
        Exchanges a currently displayed image with the image that the given URL points to. If fading is enabled the old image will be faded out and the new image faded in simultaneously.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the image to show
        notifier - a callback that is issued when the image is loaded and has faded in

      • onLoad

        protected void onLoad()

      • onUnload

        protected void onUnload()

      • quickExchangeImage

        protected void quickExchangeImage(java.lang.String url)
        Exchanges the current image quickly without fading.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the new image to be displayed
